description: Account that owns the saved search; determines visibility and management rights. System-owned entries are platform defaults.
Workgroup context the search is associated with or limited to.
Application module or feature the search pertains to; used to route and execute the saved query in the correct context.
User-friendly title shown in the interface for this saved search.
Boolean flag indicating whether the entry is a built-in/system search or user-defined.
Serialized criteria (typically JSON) defining filters, selected columns, and parameters used when running the search.
User who created the saved search.
Timestamp when the saved search was created.
User who last modified the saved search.
Timestamp of the most recent edit to the saved search.
Optional UI color/style tag applied to the saved search for visual grouping.
Category for dynamic system searches that drives automatic filtering behavior.
Display order of the search within its list; lower values appear first.
Additional JSON payload for extended search configuration; likely deprecated or superseded by the primary criteria field; confirm with SME.
When set, designates this search as the default selection for applicable users or workgroups opening the module; confirm scope with SME.
Indicates whether and how the search is shared beyond the owner; confirm encoding with SME.
Named sort preset applied when running the search.
